name: HabitBloom
description: A visually soft, friendly habit-tracking app with daily, weekly, and monthly views.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: HabitBloom is a visually soft and friendly habit-tracking app designed to help users build positive routines. With intuitive daily, weekly, and monthly views, simple progress circles, and customizable habit cards, HabitBloom offers a minimal, motivational, and clutter-free experience to foster lasting habits and personal growth.
current_prd.problem_statement: Many individuals struggle with establishing and maintaining consistent habits due to overwhelming interfaces, lack of visual motivation, and difficulty in tracking progress effectively. Existing habit trackers often feel rigid, complex, or visually unappealing, leading to user disengagement and abandonment.
current_prd.solution: HabitBloom provides a visually soft, friendly, and minimal interface that simplifies habit tracking. It offers clear daily, weekly, and monthly progress views, motivating streak indicators, and customizable habit cards, fostering a positive and clutter-free environment for users to build and maintain healthy habits.

key_features.feature_description: Intuitive navigation to view habit progress across different timeframes.
Visually appealing circles that show completion percentage for each habit.
Indicators that highlight consecutive days of habit completion to motivate users.
Personalized cards for each habit, allowing users to set names, icons, colors, and reminders.
Backend APIs for managing user accounts, habit data, and progress tracking.
Scalable cloud infrastructure to handle growing user base and data volume.
Secure data storage and transmission protocols to protect user information.
Admin dashboard for managing users, monitoring system health, and content updates.
Tools for customer support to assist users with account or habit-related issues.
Tracking of user engagement, habit completion rates, and feature usage.
System for logging errors and performance metrics to ensure app stability.
Automated deployment pipelines for efficient updates and rollbacks.
Tools and processes for ongoing maintenance and support of the application.

steps: User taps 'Add Habit' button
User enters habit name, frequency, and reminder settings
User selects icon and color for the habit card
User taps 'Save Habit'
System creates new habit entry and displays it on the dashboard
User views daily habit list
User taps on a habit card to mark it complete
System updates habit status, progress circle, and streak indicator
System records completion timestamp
User navigates to the 'Weekly' view
System displays a summary of habit completion for the current week
User can scroll through past weeks to review progress
Admin logs into the admin dashboard
Admin navigates to 'User Management' section
Admin can view, edit, or deactivate user accounts
System updates user status in the database
Operations team accesses performance monitoring tools
System displays real-time metrics (CPU, memory, network usage)
Alerts are triggered for anomalies or thresholds breaches
Operations team investigates and resolves issues

current_prd.success_metrics: Increase daily active users by 20% within the first six months. Achieve a 7-day habit retention rate of 60%. Maintain an average app store rating of 4.5 stars or higher. Reduce user-reported bugs by 15% quarter-over-quarter.
current_prd.competitors: Habitica, Streaks, Productive, Loop Habit Tracker, Fabulous, Todoist (with habit features)
current_prd.vision: To become the most beloved and visually calming habit-tracking application, empowering millions to effortlessly cultivate positive habits, achieve personal goals, and lead more fulfilling lives through a delightful and clutter-free digital experience.

target_audience.name: New Habit Formers
target_audience.pain_points: Overwhelmed by complex apps, difficulty staying consistent, lack of motivation, forgetting to track habits.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 20-40, tech-savvy, health-conscious, students and young professionals.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Easy-to-use interface, visual motivation, gentle reminders, clear progress tracking.

target_audience.name: Consistent Habit Maintainers
target_audience.pain_points: Apps becoming cluttered over time, losing motivation after initial excitement, difficulty seeing long-term progress.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 25-50, professionals, parents, individuals seeking self-improvement.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Long-term tracking, streak preservation, customizable views, minimal distractions.

phasing.rationale: This phase establishes the fundamental user experience, allowing users to create, track, and view their habits. It includes the essential backend and infrastructure to support these core functions securely, making it suitable for a compelling demo or a very early MVP launch.

Building on the core functionality, this phase introduces motivational elements (streaks) to enhance user engagement. Crucially, it integrates essential monitoring and deployment tools, preparing the application for a more stable and iterative beta launch by allowing developers to quickly identify and address issues.

This final phase focuses on the tools required for comprehensive operational management, user support, and strategic growth. It enables administrators to manage the platform, support users effectively, gather insights into usage, and ensure the long-term health and evolution of HabitBloom for a full public launch.

current_prd.design_principles:
Simplicity: Clean, uncluttered interface with intuitive interactions.
Positivity & Encouragement: Gentle visual cues and motivational feedback to foster a positive habit-building experience.
Clarity & Focus: Clear presentation of progress, streaks, and habit information without overwhelming the user.
Customization: Empower users to personalize their habit cards and app experience to suit their individual needs.

user_personas.name: Anna, The Aspiring Achiever
user_personas.goals: Build consistent healthy habits (e.g., drink water, meditate), track progress visually, feel motivated without pressure.
user_personas.pain_points: Forgetting to track habits, feeling overwhelmed by complex apps, losing motivation due to lack of visual feedback.

user_personas.name: David, The Habit Builder
user_personas.goals: Establish new routines (e.g., exercise, learning), receive gentle reminders, easily customize habits to fit a busy schedule.
user_personas.pain_points: Forgetting to start new habits, difficulty integrating new routines into a busy day, lack of clear guidance on habit setup.

steps.description: Opens the app and lands on the Home screen (Daily View).
Displays customizable habit cards, including "Drink Water," with a simple progress circle.
Taps on the "Drink Water" habit card to mark a serving.
Updates the progress circle for "Drink Water" and shows a positive visual confirmation. Updates streak indicator if applicable.
Swipes to the Weekly View to see her overall progress for the week.
Displays a summary of weekly habit progress with simple visual indicators.

user_journeys.context: Anna wants to track her daily "Drink Water" habit and see her progress.
user_journeys.trigger: Anna opens the app in the morning to log her first glass of water.

steps.description: Navigates to the 'Habits' section from the bottom tab navigation.
Displays a list of existing habits and an 'Add New Habit' button.
Presents a form for creating a new habit, including fields for name, frequency (daily), reminders, and color customization.
Enters 'Morning Stretch', sets it to daily, chooses a soft blue color, and sets a reminder for 7:00 AM.
Confirms habit creation and adds 'Morning Stretch' to the user's habit list and Home screen.
Returns to the Home screen to see the new 'Morning Stretch' habit card.
Displays the new habit card with its chosen color and an empty progress circle.

user_journeys.context: David wants to add a new habit, 'Morning Stretch', to his daily routine.
user_journeys.trigger: David decides to incorporate a morning stretch routine into his day.

current_prd.sitemap:
Home (Daily View, Weekly View, Monthly View)
Habits (List of all habits, Add New Habit, Edit Habit)
Progress (Detailed statistics and history)
Settings (Profile, Notifications, App Preferences)
current_prd.navigation_design:
Bottom Tab Navigation:
- Home (Default view, showing daily/weekly/monthly progress)
- Habits (Access to manage all habits)
- Progress (View detailed statistics and history)
- Settings (User profile and app preferences)

In-app navigation:
- Swipe gestures for switching between daily, weekly, and monthly views on the Home screen.
- Clear back buttons for navigating out of detail screens.
current_prd.mermaid_erd_diagram:
erDiagram
User {
  INT id
  VARCHAR username
  VARCHAR email
  VARCHAR password_hash
}
Habit {
  INT id
  INT user_id
  VARCHAR name
  TEXT description
  VARCHAR frequency_type
  INT frequency_value
  TIMESTAMP start_date
  TIMESTAMP end_date
}
HabitLog {
  INT id
  INT habit_id
  TIMESTAMP log_date
  BOOLEAN is_completed
}
User ||--o{ Habit : "has"
Habit ||--o{ HabitLog : "logs"

user_stories.title: View Daily Habit Progress

user_story.i_want: to see my daily habit progress at a glance
user_story.so_that: I can easily track my accomplishments for the day and stay motivated.

acceptance_criteria: The app displays a daily view of all active habits.
Each habit card shows its current progress for the day.
The daily view is the default landing screen upon opening the app.

user_stories.title: View Weekly Habit Progress

user_story.i_want: to review my habit progress over the week
user_story.so_that: I can understand my consistency and identify areas for improvement.

acceptance_criteria: The app provides a weekly view summarizing habit completion.
Users can navigate between different weeks to review past progress.
The weekly view clearly indicates completed and incomplete habits for each day.

user_stories.title: View Monthly Habit Progress

user_story.i_want: to see my long-term habit trends
user_story.so_that: I can gain insights into my overall consistency and celebrate sustained progress.

acceptance_criteria: The app offers a monthly view displaying overall habit trends.
Users can see a high-level overview of their habit completion rates for the month.
The monthly view helps users identify long-term patterns and progress.

user_stories.title: Visualize Habit Progress with Circles

user_story.i_want: to see my habit progress visually represented
user_story.so_that: I can quickly understand my completion status and feel a sense of accomplishment.

acceptance_criteria: Each habit card displays a simple, visually soft progress circle.
The progress circle updates in real-time as the user marks habit steps complete.
The progress circle clearly indicates the completion percentage or status.

user_stories.title: Track Habit Streaks

user_story.i_want: to see my consecutive habit completions
user_story.so_that: I am motivated to maintain my habits and build consistency.

acceptance_criteria: The app displays a clear streak indicator for each habit.
The streak indicator updates automatically with each consecutive completion.
Users receive positive reinforcement for maintaining their streaks.

user_stories.title: Customize Habit Cards

user_story.so_that: they reflect my individual habits and preferences, making the app feel more engaging.

acceptance_criteria: Users can create new habit cards with custom names.
Users can select from a predefined set of icons for their habit cards.
Users can choose a custom color scheme for each habit card.
Users can set reminders for individual habits.

user_stories.title: Add a New Habit

user_story.i_want: to easily add new habits to track
user_story.so_that: I can quickly incorporate new goals into my routine without friction.

acceptance_criteria: The app provides an intuitive interface for adding new habits.
Users can easily input habit details such as name, frequency, and reminders.
The process for adding a new habit is quick and straightforward.

user_stories.title: Mark Habit as Complete

user_story.i_want: to quickly mark a habit as complete
user_story.so_that: I can easily log my progress and feel a sense of accomplishment.

acceptance_criteria: Users can tap on a habit card to mark it as complete for the day.
The system updates the habit's status, progress circle, and streak indicator immediately.
A positive visual confirmation is provided upon successful completion.

user_stories.title: Admin User Management

user_story.so_that: I can provide support and maintain the integrity of the user base.

acceptance_criteria: Admins can log into a dedicated dashboard.
The dashboard provides tools for viewing and managing user accounts.
Admins can edit user information and deactivate accounts.

user_stories.title: Monitor System Performance and Errors

user_story.i_want: to monitor the application's performance and errors
user_story.so_that: I can ensure system stability and quickly address any issues that arise.

acceptance_criteria: The system logs errors and performance metrics in real-time.
Operations team can access monitoring tools to view system health.
Alerts are triggered for critical issues or performance degradation.

user_stories.title: Manage User Accounts via API

user_story.i_want: to interact with user data programmatically
user_story.so_that: I can build and maintain the frontend application efficiently and securely.

acceptance_criteria: The backend provides APIs for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting user accounts.
The APIs securely handle user authentication and authorization.
The APIs are well-documented for frontend integration.

user_stories.title: Manage Habit Data via API

user_story.i_want: to interact with habit data programmatically
user_story.so_that: I can implement habit tracking features and display user progress accurately.

acceptance_criteria: The backend provides APIs for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting habit data.
The APIs support tracking habit completion and streak information.
The APIs are designed for efficient data storage and retrieval.

user_stories.title: Ensure Scalable Cloud Infrastructure

user_story.i_want: to ensure the application can handle increased load
user_story.so_that: users experience consistent performance even as the user base grows.

acceptance_criteria: The application is deployed on a scalable cloud infrastructure.
The infrastructure can handle a growing user base and increasing data volume.
The system is designed for high availability and fault tolerance.

user_stories.title: Protect User Data Security and Privacy

user_story.i_want: my personal and habit data to be secure and private
user_story.so_that: I can trust the application with my sensitive information.

acceptance_criteria: User data is stored and transmitted using secure protocols (e.g., encryption).
The application adheres to privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Regular security audits are conducted to identify and address vulnerabilities.

user_stories.title: Admin Content Management

user_story.so_that: I can keep the app fresh and engaging for users without developer intervention.

acceptance_criteria: The admin dashboard allows for managing application content (e.g., predefined habit icons, motivational messages).
Admins can update content without requiring a new app deployment.
Content changes are reflected immediately for users.

user_stories.title: Provide Customer Support Tools

user_story.i_want: to efficiently assist users with their inquiries
user_story.so_that: users receive prompt and effective help, improving their overall experience.

acceptance_criteria: Customer support tools provide access to user account and habit data (with appropriate privacy controls).
Support agents can view user issues and provide timely assistance.
The tools facilitate communication between support and users.

user_stories.title: Track Usage Analytics

user_story.i_want: to understand user behavior and app performance
user_story.so_that: I can make data-driven decisions to improve the product and user experience.

acceptance_criteria: The system tracks key user engagement metrics (e.g., daily active users, session duration).
The system tracks habit completion rates and streak statistics.
Analytics data is presented in a dashboard for product managers and stakeholders.

user_stories.title: Automate Deployment Process

user_story.i_want: to deploy updates quickly and reliably
user_story.so_that: users receive new features and bug fixes without disruption.

acceptance_criteria: Automated deployment pipelines are in place for continuous integration and delivery.
New updates can be deployed efficiently and with minimal downtime.
Rollback mechanisms are available in case of deployment issues.

user_stories.title: Provide Ongoing Maintenance and Support

user_story.i_want: to ensure the long-term health and stability of the application
user_story.so_that: users can rely on a consistently performing and secure habit tracking experience.

acceptance_criteria: The application has defined processes and tools for ongoing maintenance.
Regular security patches and software updates are applied.
A support team is available to address critical issues and provide assistance.

current_prd.tam_description: Total Addressable Market for the Global Digital Health & Wellness Applications, encompassing all mobile and web-based solutions aimed at improving personal well-being, productivity, and self-improvement.
current_prd.tam_estimation_basis: Top-down approach, considering the broad market for digital health, wellness, and productivity applications.
current_prd.tam_source: Assumed from general market reports on Digital Health Market, Wellness Apps Market (e.g., Statista, Grand View Research).
current_prd.sam_description: Serviceable Available Market for Global Habit Tracking & Self-Improvement Applications, representing the segment of digital health and wellness apps specifically focused on habit formation, tracking, and personal growth tools.
current_prd.sam_estimation_basis: Estimated as a subset (7%) of the broader Digital Health & Wellness market, focusing on the specific niche of habit tracking and self-improvement.
current_prd.sam_source: Assumed from market segmentation within Digital Health & Wellness reports.
current_prd.som_description: Serviceable Obtainable Market for HabitBloom, representing the realistic market share that HabitBloom can capture within the Global Habit Tracking & Self-Improvement App Market over a 5-year horizon, considering its unique visual appeal and user experience.
current_prd.som_estimation_basis: Conservative 1% market share estimate over 5 years, considering the competitive landscape and HabitBloom's differentiated 'visually soft and friendly' approach targeting users overwhelmed by complex apps.
current_prd.som_source: Competitive analysis of existing habit trackers and new app market entry success rates.
current_prd.pricing_model_basis: Freemium with a subscription for premium features (e.g., unlimited habits, advanced analytics, custom themes).
current_prd.advantage_summary: Visually soft, friendly, and minimal interface; intuitive daily, weekly, and monthly views; simple progress circles; customizable habit cards; clutter-free experience; focus on motivation and lasting habits.

validations: validates :frequency_type, presence: true, inclusion: { in: %w[daily weekly custom] }
planned.model_content:
class Habit < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :user
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :habit_completions, dependent: :destroy

  validates :name, presence: true
  validates :frequency_type, presence: true, inclusion: { in: %w[daily weekly custom] }
  validates :start_date, presence: true

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:organization, :user]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateHabits < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :habits do |t|
      t.string :name, null: false
      t.text :description
      t.string :frequency_type, null: false
      t.jsonb :frequency_value, default: {}
      t.string :icon_name
      t.string :color_scheme
      t.date :start_date, null: false
      t.boolean :active, default: true

      t.references :user, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model Habit name:string description:text frequency_type:string frequency_value:jsonb icon_name:string color_scheme:string start_date:date active:boolean user:references organization:references

validations: validates :status, presence: true, inclusion: { in: %w[completed skipped missed] }
validates :completion_date, uniqueness: { scope: :habit_id, message: "has already been recorded for this habit" }
planned.model_content:
class HabitCompletion < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :habit

  validates :completion_date, presence: true
  validates :status, presence: true, inclusion: { in: %w[completed skipped missed] }
  validates :completion_date, uniqueness: { scope: :habit_id, message: "has already been recorded for this habit" }

  rhino_owner :habit
  rhino_references [:habit]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateHabitCompletions < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :habit_completions do |t|
      t.date :completion_date, null: false
      t.string :status, null: false, default: "completed"

      t.references :habit, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
    add_index :habit_completions, [:habit_id, :completion_date], unique: true
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model HabitCompletion completion_date:date status:string habit:references

planned.model_content:
class Icon < ApplicationRecord
  has_one_attached :image

  validates :name, presence: true, uniqueness: true
  validates :image, presence: true

  rhino_owner_global
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateIcons < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :icons do |t|
      t.string :name, null: false, index: { unique: true }

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end

planned.model_content:
class MotivationalMessage < ApplicationRecord
  validates :content, presence: true, uniqueness: true

  rhino_owner_global
end
